New Records: The game set a new record with 18 cards (16 yellows and 2 reds), including five to players not on the field, breaking the previous high of 10 cards at the Euros
Key Match Events: Antonin Barak received the earliest sending-off in Euros history after 24 minutes for a second yellow card
Kenan Yildiz and Patrik Schick were given yellow cards while not on the field
Post-game scuffle led to additional red and yellow cards, including Tomas Soucek and Arda Guler
The game was marked by controversial decisions and high-pressure moments
Post-Match Reflections: The game's lawlessness and card distribution left a significant impact on player availability for future matches
Players like Schick faced suspension issues after yellow cards
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is noted as one of the dirtiest in Euros history
Extreme card distribution became a key narrative
